DOC.brief_summary: Title : Efficacy safety artesunate-amodiaquine combine methylene blue falciparum malaria treatment African child : randomise controlled trial . Design : Mono-centre , two arm , open randomize control study child uncomplicated falciparum malaria Burkina Faso . Phase : Phase II . Objectives : The primary objective trial study efficacy safety triple therapy artesunate ( AS ) - amodiaquine ( AQ ) - methylene blue ( MB ) give three day young child uncomplicated falciparum malaria Burkina Faso compare local standard three day artemisinin-based combination therapy ( ACT ) AS-AQ regimen . Population : Children age 6-59 month uncomplicated falciparum malaria Nouna Hospital north-western Burkina Faso . Sample size : 180 patient ( 90 per study arm ) .
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Safety Artesunate-amodiaquine-methylene Malaria Treatment Children
DOC.criteria: 659 month old child ( male female ) Weight ≥ 6kg Uncomplicated malaria cause P. falciparum Asexual parasites ≥ 2 000/µl ≤ 200 000/µl Axillary temperature ≥ 37.5°C history fever last 24 hour Burkinabe nationality Permanent residence study area intention leave surveillance period Informed consent Severe malaria ( WHO 2000 ) Vomiting ( 3 within 24 hour visit ) Any apparent significant disease , include severe malnutrition A history previous , significant adverse reaction either study drug Anaemia ( haemoglobin < 7 g/dl ) Treated trial All modern antimalarial treatment prior inclusion ( last seven day ) Simultaneous participation another investigational study Treatment investigational drug
